Question
========

Consider the following choropleth [about spending per student by school district](https://knightlab.northwestern.edu/2016/07/18/three-tools-to-help-you-make-colorblind-friendly-graphics/):

![](https://knightlab.northwestern.edu/wp-content/uploads/2016/06/npr_school_spending_map-850x585.png)

The color scale used in this graphic is best described as:

Answerlist
----------
* sequential, single-hue
* sequential, multi-hue
* diverging, single-hue
* diverging, multi-hue
* categorical

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* False, this scale is diverging
* False, this scale is diverging
* False, this scale is multi-hue
* True,
* False, this scale is diverging
